analysis.Summary: This file defines and exports the route configuration for the 'configurator' section of a Vue.js application, mapping the parent '/configurator' path and its child routes to their respective Vue components.
analysis.Purpose: To centralize and declare the router entries related to the configurator feature, enabling navigation to the configurator layout and its default Styles page with lazy loading.

Components.name: layoutConfigurator
Components.responsibility: Layout wrapper component for all configurator-related views.

Components.name: Styles
Components.responsibility: Default child page under the configurator route, handling style configurations.

Functions.name: dynamic import
Functions.purpose: Asynchronously loads the Styles.vue component when the child route is visited, enabling code splitting.

Dependencies: Webpack (for handling dynamic imports and chunk naming)
analysis.Usage: Imported into the main router setup (e.g. router/index.js) and spread into the application's routes array: import configurator from './configurator.router'; then routes: [...otherRoutes, ...configurator];
Notes: The webpackChunkName for the Styles component is set to 'signin', which may be a copyâ€“paste oversight.
Current configuration only includes a single default child route; additional children can be added under the 'children' array.
Paths are defined without leading slashes, relying on parent route concatenation.
